definitions.definition: The open admittance of having done something (especially something bad).
examples: Without the real murderer's confession , an innocent person could be jailed.

definitions.definition: A formal document providing such an admission .
examples: He forced me to sign a confession !

definitions.definition: The disclosure of one's sins to a priest for absolution . In the Roman Catholic Church , it is now also termed the sacrament of reconciliation .
examples: I went to confession and now I feel much better about what I had done.

definitions.definition: Acknowledgment of belief; profession of one's faith.
A formula in which the articles of faith are comprised; a creed to be assented to or signed, as a preliminary to admission to membership of a church; a confession of faith.
The act of professing one's love.

main_definition: The open admittance of having done something (especially something bad).
secondary_definitions: A formal document providing such an admission .
( Christianity ) The disclosure of one's sins to a priest for absolution . In the Roman Catholic Church , it is now also termed the sacrament of reconciliation .
Acknowledgment of belief; profession of one's faith.
A formula in which the articles of faith are comprised; a creed to be assented to or signed, as a preliminary to admission to membership of a church; a confession of faith.
( chiefly Japanese media ) The act of professing one's love.
